Example

data_ingestion_artifacts = create_data_ingestion_artifacts(

train_file_path=”/path/to/train.csv”, test_file_path=”/path/to/test.csv”, is_ingested=True, message=”Data successfully ingested.” )

logging.info(f”Data ingestion artifacts: {data_ingestion_artifacts}”)

fraudDetection.components.training.model_trainer module

This module implements the training of models initialized in the ModelFactory class.

It utilizes MLflow for experiment tracking and logging. The main functionality is provided by the ModelTrainer class, which performs model training, evaluation, and tracking.

Note: Ensure MLflow is properly configured with the desired tracking URI.

class fraudDetection.components.training.model_trainer.FraudetectionEstimaorModel(trained_model_object)[source]

Bases: object

Custom Estimator for trained and tested models implementing predictor. This class is designed to encapsulate a trained model object and provide a consistent interface for making predictions. :param trained_model_object: The trained model object.

trained_model_object

The trained model object encapsulated by this estimator.

predict(X)[source]

Make predictions using the encapsulated model.

Examples

>>> model = FraudDetectionEstimatorModel(trained_model)
>>> predictions = model.predict(X_test)

Note

Ensure that the provided trained model object has a ‘predict’ method.

predict(X)[source]

Make predictions using the encapsulated model. :param X: Input data for making predictions. :type X: Numpy.array

Returns:

Predicted values.
